rationale: The knowledge of microwave devices is essential for electronics and communication engineering diploma holders and they need to assimilate it in order to maintain Microwave devices used in Telecommunication Industry. Hence, the basic knowledge of microwave signal generation, propagation, amplification and measurement is vital. This course has been designed so that the diploma engineer can achieve skills to maintain microwave devices, components and accessories used in telecommunication industry.
competency: Install and Maintain microwave devices, components and accessories used in telecommunication field.

courseOutcomes.description: Distinguish Electromagnetic wave propagation through reflections from voltage and Current transmission.
Analyze performance of microwave components from field point of view.
Maintain microwave components and Set up of microwave bench for optimum Operation.
Maintain microwave semiconductor devices used to realized amplifiers and Oscillators.
Maintain SONAR and RADAR systems as microwave application.

unitOutcomes.description: Describe EM wave frequency bands and spectrum
State the strengths and limitations of microwave communication
Explain the equivalent circuit of a two wire transmission line
Obtain the general equation for a two wire transmission line
State characteristics of lossless transmission line
Explain impedance matching using stub
Using design equations solve examples of single stub matching
Describe propagation of microwaves through waveguide and explain cutoff wavelength
Differentiate between transmission line and waveguide
Calculate cut off wavelength, group and phase velocities, characteristics wave impedance of any waveguide parameters
Distinguish the following: cut off wavelength, group and phase velocities, characteristics wave impedance, TE, TM modes, S Parameters
Compare the working of rectangular waveguide and circular waveguide
State applications of following microwave components: Tees, hybrid ring, directional coupler, Duplexer, isolator, circulator, cavity resonators
Differentiate E-Plane Tee, H-Plane Tee and magic Tee
Explain the working of directional coupler, isolator and circulator with sketches
Explain working of cavity resonators with sketches
Describe working of bends, corner, twist and taper with sketches
Describe the frequency limitations of vacuum tubes at microwave frequency
Explain function of reflex klystron with the help of applegate diagram
Explain structure and effects of various fields' acts on electron moving in the magnetron tube
Describe working of Travelling Wave Tube as an amplifier
Explain π mode oscillation and define frequency pushing and pulling
Explain two cavity klystron with applegate diagram
Describe working of Backward Wave Oscillator
Explain microwave power measurement methods
Explain significance of VSWR measurement
Explain attenuation measurement methods
Describe 'Q' measurement technique
Explain hazards due to microwave radiation

topics.title: Limitations of vacuum tubes at microwave frequency
Microwave tube amplifiers
subtopics: Klystron - Two cavity and multi cavity

unitOutcomes.description: Explain Varactor diode's working with diagrams
Describe transfer electron effect using the energy level diagram for GUNN diode
Explain the working of GUNN diode as an oscillator
Explain principle, construction, working and application of TUNNEL diode
Explain the working of a PIN diode as a switch
Explain the negative resistance principle for IMPATT/TRAPATT diode with sketches
Explain the parametric amplifier with diagrams
Explain the frequency up and down conversion concepts for parametric amplifier
Explain the concept of high electron mobility transistor / strip line and micro strip circuits in brief
Describe working of RUBY MASER

topics.title: Strip line and micro strip circuits

unitOutcomes.description: Explain basic principle of RADAR and SONAR
Using given data for RADAR calculate the RADAR range /minimum received power / operating frequency range
Obtain the equation for maximum RADAR range
Using RADAR range equation, describe, how various parameters affect the maximum range
Explain scanning and tracking methods used in RADAR communication
Explain the working of pulsed RADAR with the help of block diagram
Describe display methods used for RADAR
Explain the principle of CW Doppler RADAR and define blind speed
Describe the working of MTI RADAR with the help of suitable sketch
Explain how the CW RADAR used for range measurement
Compare the pulsed RADAR and CW RADAR

topics.title: Introduction
subtopics: Basic principle of RADAR and SONAR

practicalExercises.description: Measure open circuit & short circuit parameters for the given length of Transmission line
Measure VSWR & reflection coefficient for given length of transmission line
Set the microwave bench for optimum frequency operation
Measure the voltage maxima and minima on slotted waveguide and calculate free space, cut off and guided wavelength
Identify various microwave components in the microwave circuit.(PART-1)
Identify various microwave components in the microwave circuit.(PART-2)
Determine the directivity, insertion loss, and coupling factor for a given directional coupler
Determine the isolation factor for a given isolator
Determine the coupling factor and, insertion loss, for a given circulator
Measure microwave frequency using the given (direct and /or indirect) frequency meter
Measure VSWR for given microwave loads
Test different controls and functions of GUNN / KLYSTRON power supply

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Microwave accessories BNC to BNC cables, Main Chords

Implement all circuits on breadboard and verify the design
